description: Array of square numbers read by antidiagonals in up direction.
comments: A simple permutation of natural numbers.a(n) is a pairing function: a function that reversibly maps Z^{+} x Z^{+} onto Z^{+}, where Z^{+} is the set of integer positive numbers. - Boris Putievskiy, Jan 09 2013
links: Boris Putievskiy, Transformations [of] Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO].
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: T(n+1, k)=n*n+k, T(k, n+1)=(n+1)*(n+1)+1-k, 1 <= k <= n+1.a(n)=i^2-j+1 if i >= j, a(n)=(j-1)^2 + i if i <  j, where i=n-t*(t+1)/2,j=(t*t+3*t+4)/2-n, t=floor[(-1+sqrt(8*n-7))/2]. - Boris Putievskiy, Jan 09 2013
